field.name: summary
field.value: Lifestyle mismatches between WCF and Windsor for services should be detected and reported

field.name: description
field.value:
That's based on actual case reported by one of my colleagues where they were using Windsor to register their service which was InstanceMode.PerCall and Windsor registered it as singleton, since they didn't specify the lifestyle explicitly.
Windsor should either pick the best matching lifestyle based on the WCF settings if none is specified or perhaps throw/log if they don't match? I think throwing is too much but I'm open to suggestions.
